an6.21:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying among the Sakyans near the little village of Sāma, by a lotus pond.
an6.21:1.2: Then, late at night, a glorious deity, lighting up the entire lotus pond, went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him,
an6.21:2.1: “Sir, three qualities lead to the decline of a mendicant.
an6.21:2.4: These three qualities lead to the decline of a mendicant.”
an6.21:2.7: Then that deity, knowing that the teacher approved, bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.
an6.21:3.1: Then, when the night had passed, the Buddha told the mendicants all that had happened, adding:
an6.21:3.9: “It’s unfortunate for those of you who even the deities know are declining in skillful qualities.
an6.21:4.1: I will teach you three more qualities that lead to decline.
an6.21:4.2: Listen and pay close attention, I will speak.”
an6.21:4.5: “And what, mendicants, are three qualities that lead to decline?
an6.21:4.6: Enjoyment of company, being hard to admonish, and having bad friends.
an6.21:4.7: These three qualities lead to decline.
an6.21:5.1: Whether in the past, future, or present, all those who decline in skillful qualities do so because of these six qualities.”
